intro: Conostylis spinuligera, commonly known as the spinyligera lily or spikeless lily, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in a dense spike, typically blooming during the cooler months. Conostylis spinuligera is often found in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of native grassland ecosystems.
